meanings.definition: Something that completes or brings to perfection.
meanings.sent1: The dessert was the perfect complement to the meal.
meanings.sent2: She believed that her red shoes were the ideal complement to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The funny hat was an unexpected complement to his serious suit.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality complements her calm demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers were a beautiful complement to the green garden.

meanings.definition: A quantity or number needed to make a group complete.
meanings.sent1: We only need two more chairs to have the full complement for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The team was missing a key player to have a full complement on the field.
meanings.sent3: The missing puzzle piece completed the complement of the jigsaw.
meanings.sent4: The final ingredient was the complement needed to finish the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The last book in the series was the missing complement to her collection.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that completes the meaning of another word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence 'She is a doctor,' 'doctor' is the complement.
meanings.sent2: The adjective 'happy' is the complement in the phrase 'very happy.'
meanings.sent3: The word 'not' is the complement that changes the meaning of the sentence.
meanings.sent4: The phrase 'in the garden' is the complement that specifies the location.
meanings.sent5: The word 'beautiful' is the complement that describes the flower.
